summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 13-15, 2019, arranging a visit by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman and other DOJ officials to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The visit's purpose is to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area, the 9th floor SHU, and Jeffrey Epstein's cell, which is noted as still being cordoned off. The emails coordinate logistics, including the request that only MCC legal staff escort the group and that they not speak to guards due to ongoing investigations.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 13-15, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman requested to visit and inspect Epstein's cell at the MCC, which was noted as still being cordoned off.
The visit aimed to inspect the 2nd floor psych observation/suicide watch area and the 9th floor Special Housing Unit (SHU).
The group requested that only MCC legal staff escort them and that they not speak to any guards due to ongoing investigations.
The correspondence reveals immediate high-level DOJ interest in the conditions of Epstein's detention and death scene.
